Package: com.github.jrubygradle

[Groovy] Class JRubyExec

      • com.github.jrubygradle.JRubyExec
      • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
        JRubyExecTraits

        class JRubyExec
extends JavaExec

        Runs a ruby script using JRuby

        Authors:
        Schalk W. Cronj√©

            java.lang.String  configuration
            Configuration to copy gems from.
            java.lang.String  jrubyVersion
            If it is required that a JRubyExec task needs to be executed with a different version of JRuby that the globally configured one, it can be done by setting it here.

        • Property Detail

          • static final java.lang.String JAR_DEPENDENCIES_VERSION

          • static final java.lang.String JRUBYEXEC_CONFIG

          • @Optional @Input java.lang.String configuration

            Configuration to copy gems from. If jRubyVersion has not been set, jRubyExec will used as configuration. However, if jRubyVersion has been set, not gems will be used unless an explicit configuration has been provided

          • @Input java.lang.String jrubyVersion

            If it is required that a JRubyExec task needs to be executed with a different version of JRuby that the globally configured one, it can be done by setting it here.

        • Constructor Detail

          • JRubyExec()

        • Method Detail

          • @java.lang.Override JavaExec args(java.lang.Object... args)

          • @java.lang.Override JavaExecSpec args(java.lang.Iterable<?> args)

          • void configuration(java.lang.String cfg)

            Sets the configurations

            Parameters:
            cfg - Name of configuration

          • @java.lang.Override void exec()

          • @java.lang.Override java.util.List<java.lang.String> getArgs()

            getArgs gets overridden in order to add JRuby options, script name and script arguments in the correct order. There are three modes of behaviour

            • script set. no jrubyArgs, or jrubyArgs does not contain -S - Normal way to execute script. A check whether the script exists will be performed.
            • script set. jrubyArgs contains -S - If script is not absolute, no check will be performed to see if the script exists and will be assumed that the script can be found using the default ruby path mechanism.
            • script not set, but jrubyArgs set - Set up to execute jruby with no script. This should be a rarely used otion.
            Throws:
            org.gradle.api.InvalidUserDataException if mode of behaviour cannot be determined.

          • java.lang.String getComputedPATH(java.lang.String originalPath)

            Return the computed `PATH` for the task

          • @Optional @Input java.io.File getGemWorkDir()

            Returns the directory that will be used to unpack GEMs in.

            Returns:
            Target directory
            Since:
            0.1.9

          • @Input boolean getInheritRubyEnv()

            Allow JRubyExec to inherit a Ruby env from the shell (e.g. RVM)

            Since:
            0.1.10

          • @Optional @Input java.util.List<java.lang.String> getJrubyArgs()

            Returns a list of jruby arguments

          • java.lang.String getJrubyConfigurationName()

            Returns the Configuration object this task is tied to

          • java.util.Map getPreparedEnvironment(java.util.Map env)

          • @Optional @Input java.io.File getScript()

            Script to execute.

            Returns:
            The path to the script (or nul if not set)

          • @Optional @Input java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getScriptArgs()

            Returns a list of script arguments

          • static java.lang.String jarDependenciesGemLibPath(java.io.File gemDir)

          • void jrubyVersion(java.lang.String ver)

            Setting the jruby-complete version allows for tasks to be run using different versions of JRuby. This is useful for comparing the results of different version or running with a gem that is only compatible with a specific version or when running a script with a different version that what will be packaged.

            Parameters:
            version - String in the form '1.7.13'
            Since:
            0.1.18

          • @java.lang.Override JavaExec setArgs(java.lang.Iterable<?> applicationArgs)

          • void setJrubyVersion(java.lang.String version)

            Setting the jruby-complete version allows for tasks to be run using different versions of JRuby. This is useful for comparing the results of different version or running with a gem that is only compatible with a specific version or when running a script with a different version that what will be packaged.

            Parameters:
            version - String in the form '1.7.13'

          • @java.lang.Override JavaExec setMain(java.lang.String mainClassName)

          • static void updateJRubyDependencies(Project proj)
